intro: Maranthes aubrevillei, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
